most_active_tickets.title: Copilot doesn't use workstream activities properly.(It can't find data)
Workstream activity can't update last week tasks
Pieces OS not running or responding after latest tahoe beta update
An error occurred in the authentication flow.

common_issues.title: Copilot fails to utilize workstream activities
common_issues.description: Copilot cannot access or process workstream activity data, especially when selecting multiple activities or specific time ranges.  This issue prevents accurate daily work reports.  The problem appears to affect macOS desktop application version 4.2.1.  Potential solutions include checking data access permissions, verifying Copilot integration with workstreams, and ensuring data consistency within the workstream database.

related_issues.title: Copilot doesn't use workstream activities properly.(It can't find data)
related_issues.text:
Copilot doesn't use workstream activities properly.(It can't find data)
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

4.2.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Last week, I used the copilot for creating report of the day's work logs.
It worked properly but I doesn't work since yesterday(I don't know the issue starts from yesterday but I detected it on yesterday)

Copliot can't find the activities in workstream and It doesn't care about time range selection.

It works when using 'start copilot chat' button in specific activity, but can't use with multiple activities.

I hope to use it for creating daily work report everyday.

- requested today's daily work report
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/fb4e4763-8866-432f-9ce5-12b4a0b4eead)
- requested today's daily work report using english
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/e11a9ed2-2714-4f2b-8d6b-c3272dccafbd)
- showing that I have acitivities
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/3c27034e-0640-45b5-8da8-83e715b95e5e)

common_issues.title: macOS App Issues & Pieces OS Problems
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing issues with the desktop application on macOS, including Pieces OS failing to run or respond after the latest Tahoe beta update.  Additional problems involve difficulty updating last week's workstream activities. Troubleshooting may involve verifying dependencies, restarting the application, or checking for compatibility with the latest OS and Tahoe beta versions.

common_issues.title: Authentication and Startup Issues in Pieces OS
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing authentication errors ("An error occurred in the authentication flow") on Windows 11 and application startup failures on macOS after the latest Tahoe beta update.  The authentication error occurs on new installations and affects both Firefox and Edge browsers.  The macOS startup issue renders the application unresponsive.  Further investigation is needed to determine the root cause and potential solutions for both issues.

related_issues.title: An error occurred in the authentication flow.
related_issues.text:
An error occurred in the authentication flow.
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

12.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Hello,
I am receiving this message when attempting to sign-in to Pieces.

```
An error occurred in the authentication flow.
Authentication Error ID: 00000000000000000000000000000000
```

This is a new install. (.appinstaller files)
I have never used the software before.
I do not have a pieces account (yet).
Environment: Windows 11

Launched the authentication by clicking the Sign In button in the Desktop App (4.2.1)
The auth link opened Firefox and generated the error.

I tried the following:
Disabling all extensions in Firefox
Changing my default browser to Edge and re-launching using Edge.
Re-installing with the .exe files.
Reviewed the windows firewall config (Pieces added it itself)
Looked at the Pieces log file but did not see anything obvious enough that I could solve on my own. (See attached)

[log-06252025-copy.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/20907036/log-06252025-copy.txt)

Thank you for the help.
Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

recommendations: Prioritize resolving the Copilot's inability to utilize workstream activities, especially on macOS, given its impact on daily work reports (Issue #765).
Investigate and address the macOS application and Pieces OS stability issues arising after the latest Tahoe beta update, including startup failures and slowdowns (Issues #768, #770).
Troubleshoot and fix the authentication flow error encountered by new Windows 11 users on Firefox and Edge browsers (Issue #769).
Address the issue of workstream activities not updating correctly for past tasks (Issue #763).
Improve communication with users regarding ongoing issues and expected resolution timelines.
